TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AutomationFocusChangedEventArgs extends System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for a focus-changed event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 idObject, int32 idChild) cil managed
Public Sub New (idObject As Integer, idChild As Integer)

Docs.param: The identifier (ID) of the object that received focus.
The child ID of the object that received focus.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `idObject` and `idChild` parameters contain the Microsoft Active Accessibility object identifiers that UI Automation clients can use to link an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> to an `IAccessible` object in an older accessible technology application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ChildId As Integer
public: property int ChildId { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: [get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]
[<get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Gets the child Microsoft Active Accessibility identifier of the object receiving focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Object IDs are 32-bit values that identify categories of accessible objects within an application. The `idObject` and `idChild` parameters contain the object IDs that clients can use to link an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> to an `IAccessible` object in an older accessible technology application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ObjectId As Integer
public: property int ObjectId { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: [get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]
[<get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Gets the identifier (ID) of the Microsoft Active Accessibility object that generated the event.
Docs.value: The ID of the user interface (UI) element that is receiving focus. For possible values, see Object Identifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Object IDs are 32-bit values that identify categories of accessible objects within an application. The `idObject` and `idChild` parameters contain the object IDs that clients can use to link an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> to an `IAccessible` object in an older accessible technology application.
